resources.string: The Igbo language, one of the four official languages in Nigeria, is the principal native language of the Igbo people, an ethnic group of southeastern Nigeria. The language currently has approximately 24 million speakers.

The Hausa language, one of the four official languages in Nigeria, is the principal native language of the Huasa People and the Chadic language, and ethnic group of northern Nigeria. The language currently has approximately 41 million speakers.

The Yoruba language, also one of the four official languages in Nigeria, is the principal native language of the Yoruba people, an ethnic group of western Nigeria. The language currently has approximately 30 million speakers.
